description:
LOS ANGELES – Nina Dobrev, 27, who announced in April that she is leaving “Vampire Diaries,” choked up during her speech at the Teen Choice Awards. Dobrev spoke about the importance of change in life as she won for choice TV show: sci-fi/fantasy and also choice TV liplock with her former costar --and ex-boyfriend-- Ian Somerhalder.洛杉矶——今年27岁的妮娜·杜波夫于4月发布声明她将离开《吸血鬼日记》。她在青少年选择奖上的演讲期间哽咽。她谈到了由于赢得了最佳科幻/幻想类电视剧以及与她的前搭档，也是前男友的伊恩·萨默海尔德一起获得的电视剧类最佳湿吻奖而带来的重要改变。

"Change is necessary – necessary for you to grow and to learn and to better yourself,” she said on stage. “Because everything in your life comes to an end. And, as this chapter in my life comes to an end, I look back at it with a grateful heart, and I smile."她在台上说道：“改变是必要的——对成长、对学习以及对如何做更好的自己是必要的。因为生命中任何事都会有一个终点。当这一章节在我生命中完结时，我回首时带着感恩的心并且微笑以对。”

FOX411 caught up with Dobrev on the carpet and she shared what she wished she knew when she was younger that would have made life a whole lot easier.FOX411在红毯上采访了杜波夫。她表示如果她年轻时明白这些，那么可以使她的整个生活轻松些。

“I didn’t know then but I know now—a little bit of advice is— to let everyday go day by day and learn and be OK with the fact that it’s not always going to be okay but it’s going to get better.”“我以前不知道但现在知道了——一个小小的建议——让日子一天一天的过去并从中体会，接受并不能永远完美但可以变得更好的事实。”

The actress alluded to things “getting better” in her acceptance speech about moving on with her career.关于她的演艺事业进展，她在获奖感言中暗示情况“正在变好”。

“So the last two months have been a pretty big change to me,” she said. "Change. It's a scary word – or at least I used to think that – because it meant new beginnings, new beginnings with a future that's unknown.”她说：“过去的两个月带给我了很大的改变。改变，是一个可怕的词——或者至少我曾经这样认为——因为这意味着通向一个未知未来的新的开始。”
